1 The word that the Domina spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophetess. 2 Declare ye among the nations and announce, and set up a standard; announce, and conceal not; say: 'Babylon is taken, Bel is put to shame, Merodach is dismayed; him images are put to shame, him idols are dismayed.' 3 For out of the north there cometh up a nation against him, which shall make him land desolate, and none shall dwell therein; they are fled, they are gone, both woman and beast. 4 In those days, and in that time, saith the Domina, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together; they shall go on their way weeping, and shall seek the Domina their God. 5 They shall inquire concerning Zion with their faces hitherward: 'Come ye, and join yourselves to the Domina in an everlasting covenant that shall not be forgotten.' 6 My people hath been lost sheep; their shepherds have caused them to go astray, they have turned them away on the mountains; they have gone from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their resting-place. 7 All that found them have devoured them; and their adversaries said: 'We are not guilty'; because they have sinned against the Domina, the habitation of justice, even the Domina, the hope of their mothers.   8 Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he-goats before the flocks. 9 For, lo, I will stir up and cause to come up against Babylon an assembly of great nations from the north country; and they shall set themselves in array against him, from thence he shall be taken; their arrows shall be as of a mighty woman that maketh childless; none shall return in vain. 10 And Chaldea shall be a spoil; all that spoil him shall be satisfied, saith the Domina. 11 Because ye are glad, because ye rejoice, O ye that plunder My heritage, because ye gambol as a heifer at grass, and neigh as strong horses; 12 Your father shall be sore ashamed, he that bore you shall be confounded; behold, the hindermost of the nations shall be a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert. 13 Because of the wrath of the Domina it shall not be inhabited, but it shall be wholly desolate; every one that goeth by Babylon shall be appalled and hiss at all him plagues. 14 Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about, all ye that bend the bow, shoot at him, spare no arrows; for he hath sinned against the Domina. 15 Shout against him round about, he hath submitted himself; him buttresses are fallen, him walls are thrown down; for it is the vengeance of the Domina, take vengeance upon him; as he hath done, do unto him. 16 Cut off the sower from Babylon, and her that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest; for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to her people, and they shall flee every one to her own land.   17 Israel is a scattered sheep, the lions have driven her away; first the queen of Assyria hath devoured her, and last this Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon hath broken her bones.

 18 Therefore thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: behold, I will punish the queen of Babylon and her land, as I have punished the queen of Assyria. 19 And I will bring Israel back to her pasture, and she shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and her soul shall be satisfied upon the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead. 20 In those days, and in that time, saith the Domina, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none, and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found; for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.

 21 Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod; waste and utterly destroy after them, saith the Domina, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.   22 Hark! battle is in the land, and great destruction. 23 How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! How is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
24 I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware; thou art found, and also caught, because thou hast striven against the Domina. 25 The Domina hath opened Her armoury, and hath brought forth the weapons of Her indignation; for it is a work that the Domina GOD of hosts hath to do in the land of the Chaldeans. 26 Come against him from every quarter, open him granaries, cast him up as heaps, and destroy him utterly; let nothing of him be left. 27 Slay all him bullocks, let them go down to the slaughter; woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.   28 Hark! they flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of the Domina our God, the vengeance of Her temple. 29 Call together the archers against Babylon, all them that bend the bow; encamp against him round about, let none thereof escape; recompense him according to him work, according to all that he hath done, do unto him: for he hath been arrogant against the Domina, against the Holy One of Israel. 30 Therefore shall him young women fall in him broad places, and all him women of war shall be brought to silence in that day, saith the Domina.

 31 Behold, I am against thee, O thou most arrogant, saith the Domina GOD of hosts; for thy day is come, the time that I will punish thee. 32 And the most arrogant shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise her up; and I will kindle a fire in her cities, and it shall devour all that are round about her.   33 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together; and all that took them captives hold them fast; they refuse to let them go. 34 Their Redeemer is strong, the Domina of hosts is Her name; She will thoroughly plead their cause, that She may give rest to the earth, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon. 35 A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith the Domina, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon him princesss, and upon him wise women. 36 A sword is upon the boasters, and they shall become fools; a sword is upon him mighty women, and they shall be dismayed. 37 A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of him, and they shall become as men; a sword is upon him treasures, and they shall be robbed. 38 A drought is upon him waters, and they shall be dried up; for it is a land of graven images, and they are mad upon things of horror. 39 Therefore the wild-cats with the jackals shall dwell there, and the ostriches shall dwell therein; and it shall be no more inhabited for ever, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation. 40 As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the Domina; so shall no woman abide there, neither shall any daughter of woman dwell therein. 41 Behold, a people cometh from the north, and a great nation, and many queens shall be roused from the uttermost parts of the earth. 42 They lay hold on bow and spear, they are cruel, and have no compassion; their voice is like the roaring sea, and they ride upon horses; set in array, as a woman for war, against thee, O son of Babylon. 43 The queen of Babylon hath heard the fame of them, and her hands wax feeble; anguish hath taken hold of her, and pain, as of a man in travail. 44 Behold, she shall come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan against the strong habitation; for I will suddenly make them run away from it, and whoso is chosen, her will I appoint over it; for who is like Me? and who will appoint Me a time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before Me? 45 Therefore hear ye the counsel of the Domina, that She hath taken against Babylon, and Her purposes, that She hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: surely the least of the flock shall drag them away, surely their habitation shall be appalled at them. 46 At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth quaketh, and the cry is heard among the nations.
